tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson present a mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Jessica Stewart, Rana Hussain and Bruce Djite discuss the AFLW Grand Final, the fallout from the First Ashes Test and take a look back on the biggest sporting moments from the year. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: With the rise of race-based attacks over the war in Gaza, Australias Jewish and Muslim communities are traumatised and afraid. Benjamin Law discovers how some friendships have fractured, while others are strengthened.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Were celebrating Jane Edmansons 38 years on the ABC! Costa joins her for a walk through a new display of dry climate natives, Jane visits an Edna Walling-designed property, and we look back at her iconic career highlights.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two stories of separation... a man whose only memento of his birth family is an old article, which shows them evicted from their home; and a mother searching for her only child, who she hasnt seen since he was ten days old.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Psychologist Paul North has employed his son Josh to take on the task of building a bullet proof earth berm house, deep in New South Wales Yass Valley, to protect them from bushfires and the extremes of climate change.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Bites
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson shares stress-reducing tips for holiday entertaining and, how to make soup from turkey leftovers.

programme.title: The Art Of...
programme.desc: Do we care too much about winning? To find out, Namila Benson enters a unique competition and talks to artists Abdul Abdullah, Jamie Cooper, Woopsyang and musician Nooky.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A hit and run and a stabbing death in a remote Northumberland valley have DCI Vera Stanhope and her team investigating the connection between the two people involved.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a seemingly simple kidnapping ends in murder, DI Neville Parker and the team must work out what went wrong and how someone ended up dead.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: Bon Scott was set to become an international rock star with AC/DC in 1980 when he died suddenly. In 2022, his family and friends spoke for the first time about his vulnerabilities and state of mind before his untimely death.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Bubbles learns to embrace her "smashy side."

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: BBNO$
programme.desc: Join Vancouver viral-sensation and musical mischief-maker BBNO$ as he guest programs rage, serving up a playlist thats almost as chaotic as he is.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand is shocked when Dr Chris suggests making pizza in the lab! But little does he know, hes about to have his arms set in plaster as the Doctors reveal how your elbows work.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Marinette would like to give Adrien a gift for his birthday. But shes too shy for that, and Chloe is determined to offer him the most amazing gift.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its breakfast time and the Farmer discovers he has no fresh milk for his morning cup of tea. He sets off in great haste but Shaun and the Flock are too impatient to wait for breakfast and take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: Crongton
programme.desc: Liccle Bit runs away, finding refuge with Manjaro, but ends up in an impossible situation.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: Flamingo fights for his life, cheetah gets a biopsy, keeper love abounds.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Social media phenomenon Holly H is Rattus guest as he launches his own radio station, and plays a selection of musical greatest hits from series 8.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Misplaced Mug
programme.desc: We meet the rather eccentric Georgian philosopher Jeremy Bentham; super-rich Roman politician Crassus raps about his blinging lifestyle; and Johannes Gutenberg goes head-to-head with some monks on The Historical Apprentice.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When Cat Noir is suspected of theft, Ladybug has to prove that her partner is innocent and that a copycat is prowling around Paris. But will Ladybug be able to tell the truth from the false?

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Oswald finally lands an interview on a famous Odd Squad podcast to talk about the new Mobile Unit van, but hes only familiar with the main floor. In an attempt to learn more, Oswald gets lost and risks missing his interview.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer returns from the fair triumphant - hes won a coconut! He soon discovers getting into the coconut isnt as easy as it seems.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Do you know how your lungs move inside your ribcage? The doctors investigate with the help of a massive water slide! Look out for Todays British Sign Language sign which is dinosaur.

programme.title: Gladiators UK
programme.desc: Giant gets his toughest test yet in Duel, and its an Eliminator for the ages as the contenders battle it out for a place in the grand final.

programme.title: Rage Ausmusic Month Special
programme.desc: rage celebrates AusMusic Month all November with the creme de la creme of new music videos from Australias best and brightest.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: The City Addicted To Crystal Meth
programme.desc: Louis Theroux visits Central Valley, California, home to some of the most impoverished rural towns in America, where crystal-meth addiction is among the most prolific in the USA.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: What makes your poo brown?! Find out in todays lab experiment, and meet another brilliant body when Dr Xand discovers the incredible breathing skills needed to free dive.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: I Will Defend The World! Trunks Furious Burst Of Super Power!
programme.desc: Fighting rages on, and things are looking grim. They might not be able to win, but Future Trunks can at least defend the others while they escape! Time is running out, but a new strategy may be the key to victory.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania: The Series
programme.desc: Mavis wins two tickets to Noosh La Looshs phlegm ball fantasy camp and so Hank, Wendy, and Pedro fuse themselves into a singular monster known as Panky to be her plus one.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in Wirral to see a five bed semi thats refusing to shift from the market. Owner Dave purchased the house as an investment two years ago, but the market crashed and so did his hopes of a fast profit.

programme.title: Annabel Crabbs Civic Duty
programme.desc: Democracies operate according to rules, but they also change. Sometimes at the hands of visionary or power-hungry leaders, sometimes in response to external forces, and sometimes as a result of people power. (Final)

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Carter starts his first day as a lowly surgical intern and finds himself more stressed than ever. Carol goes back to working in the ER. Peter finds out he is HIV negative, but Jeanie Boulets HIV results are life-changing.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig delves into the topic of Questions and Qualifications, with regular panellist Alan Davies and guest players Ade Adepitan, Nish Kumar and Holly Walsh.

programme.title: The Cleaner: A Clean Christmas
programme.desc: Its Christmas Day and crime scene cleaner Wicky is looking forward to heading to the pub for Weasels Christmas raffle. All that stands in his way is a blood-soaked crime scene in an ice cream parlour.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors reveal the turbinates - three incredible bones in your nose that warm up your snot so you can breathe clearly, and find out how scientists are growing a brain in Investigation Ouch!

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Dont You Disgrace Saiyan Cells! Vegetas Fierce Battle Commences!
programme.desc: Future Trunks challenges Black and Future Zamasu on his own. Goku, Vegeta, and Bulma hurry back to save him, but upon arrival, the time machine is damaged! This time the Saiyan prince is itching to dish out some payback!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmers personal hygiene leaves much to be desired. Shaun, Bitzer and the Flock decide action is needed - and set about giving the Farmer a full service wash.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: Malcolm McDowell takes the gang on a trip through time.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: In order to live under the sea the Bears must transform into mermaids.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The Mobile Unit learns how things might have been if they hadnt joined the team, by using What-Would-It-Have-Been-Like-Inator helmets.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors make Billy Bones his very own bum and reveal the power of your gluteus maximus muscle! And find out who gets snotted in Ouchology.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: The MythBusters put classic crime movie myths to the test to seperate Hollywood heist fact from fiction.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil travels to Lincolnshire to try to help downsizers Mark and Tina sell their detached three bed house. But the house is so over personalised, a prospective purchaser will never be able to picture themselves living there.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Moxie Jillette, Daxien, The Cosmic Romantics and David Schwartz.

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: Britain is on the verge of financial meltdown and Section D must recover over 1 billion pounds from one of the worlds most impenetrable banks.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: Tombliboo Eee becomes separated from the other two Tombliboos, Unn and Ooo.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Zap decides he wants to walk on the moon and Bop builds him a set of wings, but they dont seem to work. Zaps friends decide if they cant get Zap to the moon they can bring the moon to Zap.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel is playing Splat Ball with his friends at the Enchanted Garden, but Jodis asthma makes it hard for her to run around.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas family go to the museums Moon Exhibition with Georges friend Edmond Elephant.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer is an all too willing invalid when he has to wear the cone of shame and is happy to let the flock wait on him. That is, until Shaun rumbles his malingering and plots the poochs comeuppance.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Zoe and Oliver are obsessed with a new playground craze, slime!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: While on a camping holiday, Bluey makes a new friend called Jean-Luc. Bluey may not understand him, but they find common language playing and hunting for a wild Daddy pig.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: Its a great train robbery as Silver Paw hijacks Lauchies toy train so she can steal pet treats from the kitchen, while Moss plays train driver to try and bring it home.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds meet working horses! They watch police horses train, learn to ride, and discover how reins help humans "talk" to horses. They see that horses need some care after a hard ride!

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: Lloyds testing a wind-up powered go-cart, but the Mechas need to help when it keeps running out of energy.

programme.title: The Wiggles: Wiggly Big Day Out
programme.desc: Get ready to wiggle with all your wiggly friends as they perform as part of their Wiggly Big Day Out show. Featuring Wiggles classics such as Rock-a-Bye Your Bear and Fruit Salad, as well as new hits like Hey Tsehay!

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Whiff needs help so Mac invents Robo Whiff. But the crazy robot takes over the band.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are at a Jigsaw festival with Granny and Grandpa Pig. Old Mrs Donkey explains how important it is not to lose a jigsaw piece but then Peppa spots one on the floor! Thankfully, Peppa finds its home.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Its so cold in the Valley that the Pea-Rexes risk becoming frozen! Ginger needs to keep them warm and skating around the frozen lake might just help!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When Biff and Tiffs cat-sitting duties go sideways, the brothers help out with a special build designed to chase down the precious, pesky felines who are running amok through Steamport!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: Octonauts And The Baby Sea Turtles
programme.desc: As newborn baby sea turtles make their way to the ocean, the Octonauts must steer them clear of a giant wave and hungry predators.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Bulgy thinks that people should travel by bus instead of rail until he learns that having so many passengers is not so easy for the buses on their own.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Can Sixteen to Twenty sneak past the robot guards at the Museum of Numbers?

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Realizing Mr. Lins shop could use a bit of a refresh, Millie, Ben and Alicia conspire to surprise him with a new paint job.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the junior gardeners make a seethrough worm farm to see what goes on beneath the soil with their wriggly friends.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: PC Panda brings his twin daughters to playgroup Peggi and Pandora Panda. They love puzzles and to solve mysteries just like their dad.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Squeaky Toy
programme.desc: When Peter loses Cotton-tails beloved squeaky rabbit toy, he must run the gauntlet of his enemies to get it back!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey plays mum to a brood of bouncy balloons, including an irrepressible floater named Greenie. But she soon discovers that mothering is much harder than she imagined.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: One of the chickens is laying her eggs. The chicks legs pop out of the bottom of the egg. Oh dear its a little bit stuck! Wait a minute...the egg is running off! Can the squirrels help bring it back to the chicken safely?

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: Pancakes golden algae goes missing, leaving all the Piri friends under suspicion.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Jedi younglings Kai, Lys, and Nubs go on their first adventure.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben and Holly are excited when they learn that Nanny Plum is a Tooth Fairy at night, and go along with her to pick up a little girls tooth. But the little girl is not so little - shes a human and much bigger than them!

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a man cover his car in cleaning foam. Great BigHoo and Toodloo investigate the spray nozzle. Toodloo manages to get it to work but when Chickedy and Chick have a go, the spray nozzle squirts foam everywhere.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Daniel And Max Play At The Playground
programme.desc: Daniel feels left out at the playground when theres no room for him to play with Katerina and Max at the xylophone. Maxs big sister, Amira, helps them find a way for everyone to play.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing cant wait to voosh his new Hoppity Voosh Rocket Sledge in the snow, but after taking off his gloves to make a snowman, his hands hurt! When its time to go to Windy Hill, Bing has his reservations!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family visit a new theme park: Potato City. There they discover that the magic of vegetables never ends.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Father Christmas pays a surprise visit to The Little Kingdom to check on the Christmas preparations. Everything is going according to plan until the King, the Queen and the Wise old Elf get trapped...

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit gives Peppa and friends a tennis lesson, but the tennis balls get everywhere! So, the children play badminton instead and its a lot easier.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes guide a young Strawberrisaurus to find the courage to perform a special friendship dance that will help them find a lifelong playmate.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Walrus Chief
programme.desc: When Pesos precious medical kit is taken, Barnacles and Kwazii sneak into a dangerous walrus colony to get it back - disguised as a walrus!

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish and Bobby are having trouble finishing their vegetables during dinner time so, Rosa and Pola have taken away the cake until they are finished.

programme.title: Play School: Let The Games Begin
programme.desc: Get ready to race with Leah and Luke! They are joined by Australian Sprinter Calab Law for a nail-biting running race between toys Maurice and Jemima, and commentate exciting field events with Owl, Joey, Fergus and Scrap.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Telephone Bird
programme.desc: Jay thinks they have discovered a new bird, the Telephone Bird! Nikhil wants to make it real for his brother and feeds his imagination as he helps him to find it.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum and Dad vow to only finish their boring housework when the kids stop acting silly, but thats never going to happen, so they end up trying the same approach themselves.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In the UK, find out how to make a clever corner creature in under a minute; in Hong Kong discover how to create a brilliant bottle bird; and in South Africa a Mini Maker has fun with some colourful tissue paper pieces.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When Thomas friends notice hes glum about Percy being away for repairs on the Mainland, they try to help him by playing a game to see whos the best at cheering him up until Percy returns.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: PC Panda brings his twin daughters to playgroup Peggi and Pandora Panda. They love puzzles and to solve mysteries just like their dad.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When Ginger gets a nasty tummy ache, the Pea-Rexes have to find a special soothing herb which unfortunately is in the middle of Bananaraptor island!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: While working on a comic book of his childhood Cree stories, Mikisew tells the Dream Factory Crew about his tree fort and inspires them to hunt for the lost hang out.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts must get two mantis shrimp to stop fighting before their powerful claw strikes destroy the Octopod.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: When Rebecca works with the Troublesome Trucks everyone expects the worst, but Rebecca defies expectations and has a very chucklesome day.

programme.title: Play School: When I Grow Up
programme.desc: Alex and Justine are joined by Tim Minchin to make music and explore creative jobs! Justine is a painter, creating a masterpiece, and Alex snaps away as a nature photographer! Tim sings along to his book, When I Grow Up!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle teaches the children about Chinese New Year. They learn about sweeping out the old year, and how lucky the colour red is and together they make a dragon costume to parade up the hill to watch the fireworks.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: A triple solar eclipse is about to happen! Cosima and Big Lizard race down the volcano and hitch a lift on a dragonfly to get vital equipment to Dad in the nick of time.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When the cadets are put in charge of running the lifeguard club all by themselves, it proves to be the toughest - and most rewarding - day of their lives.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Newton is left powerless after Romeo discovers how to stop him re-energizing. If Newton hasnt got super powers, is he still a hero?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.sub-title: Paddington Gets Locked Out On Christmas Day
programme.desc: Its Christmas day and the Browns get locked out. Will they get in in time for dinner and still have a merry Christmas?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve and the presents have just been delivered to Father Christmas at the North Pole. Back at the elf tree, Mr Elf is sitting down to a nice cup of tea as Father Christmas rings up to say the toys are missing.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: A short-tempered Bibi attempts to not let Jestahs words get to her.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson present a mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.desc: Bon Scott was set to become an international rock star with AC/DC in 1980 when he died suddenly. In 2022, his family and friends spoke for the first time about his vulnerabilities and state of mind before his untimely death.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Thousands of homes left without power as a Category 3 cyclone tears through the Top End, grape growers grapple with forecast record low prices, and the holiday hotspots pricing people out of their own homes.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Join Yvonne Yong for the news from Asia: Hong Kongs deadliest fire in decades, severe flooding inundates Southeast Asia, plus Indonesias Oscars pick premieres in Australia.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Trump condemns act of terror after National Guard shooting, while a peace plan for Ukraine gains momentum. Plus with the charges against James Comey and Letitia James dismissed, will this be the final word? (Final)

programme.title: National Press Club Address
programme.sub-title: Ted OBrien - Deputy Leader of the Opposition
programme.desc: Ted OBrien, Deputy Leader of the Opposition, addresses the National Press Club of Australia.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Thousands of homes left without power as a Category 3 cyclone tears through the Top End, grape growers grapple with forecast record low prices, and the holiday hotspots pricing people out of their own homes.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the final sitting week with Karen Middleton, Paul Sakkal and Claudia Long including the Greens deal to pass environment laws, Barnaby quits the Nationals, Pauline Hansons censure, energy and inflation.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: The seven billion dollar Black Friday splurge is on but warnings over the buy now pay later debt trap. Plus attempts to deflate the housing bubble as the banking watchdog clamps down on risky loans. Presented by David Chau.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: The invasive weed taking over farmland in the Monaro; Eradicating the Australian Sheep Blowfly; Ferrying cattle over the flooded Cooper Creek by barge; and a luxurious new paddle steamer on the Murray River. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the final sitting week with Karen Middleton, Paul Sakkal and Claudia Long including the Greens deal to pass environment laws, Barnaby quits the Nationals, Pauline Hansons censure, energy and inflation.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: Designer babies with selected gender: A booming market in Northern Cyprus. Plus Boostedt, ten years after the refugee influx - integration marked by progress and conflict.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Can you tell the difference between real and AI-generated videos? We put high schoolers to the test.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: The invasive weed taking over farmland in the Monaro; Eradicating the Australian Sheep Blowfly; Ferrying cattle over the flooded Cooper Creek by barge; and a luxurious new paddle steamer on the Murray River. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best original reporting. Melissa Mackay brings you news, interviews and analysis on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas speaks with politicians and key players on the issues making news plus what weve learnt from Senate Estimates.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.
